intro: Elaphrium jamaicense, commonly known as Jamaican elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Jamaica. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
